videos_data.title: Qaiser Piya Ke Passport Se Hasad | Samaa TV
videos_data.description:
#gupshabwithvasaych #iftikharthakur #qaiserpiya #vasaychaudhry #gupshabwithvasaych #sabahameed #aliraza #actresssabahameed #actoraliraza #alirazaactor 

Qaiser Piya Ke Passport Se Hasad | Samaa TV

Who is Saba Hameed? 

Saba Hameed  is a Pakistani actress and director.

She is one of the most popular actresses of Pakistan. She was one of the most successful actress of 1980s and 1990s. She got early recognition with her role of Sumbul in sitcom Family Front which broadcast for five years. Her recent recent roles are in the TV drama series Kahin Deep Jaley, Mere Humsafar and Fitoor.

Early life
Saba was born in Lahore, Pakistan, to writer and columnist Hameed Akhtar and Saadia, a film producer. She studied at the Lahore College for Women University. Her siblings include three sisters, with Huma and Lalarukh having also been actresses, and one brother.

Career
Saba Hameed started her four-decade-long career as an actress in 1978 on television and also worked in theatre from the mid-1980s to the mid-1990s. Saba has portrayed mother's role in many dramas & telefilms.

Personal life
Saba Hameed was previously married to Syed Pervaiz Shafi, with whom she had two children: a daughter, actress and singer Meesha Shafi, and a son, Faris Shafi.She is currently married to actor Waseem Abbas. Actor Ali Abbas is Waseem Abbas's son from his first marriage. Saba's two younger sisters, Huma Hameed and Lalarukh Hameed are both actresses. Lalarukh worked in dramas Mata-e-Gharoor, Andhera Ujala, Wafa, Dasht-E-Tanhai and Hazaron Raaste.

Whos is Ali Raza?

Muhammad Ali Raza (born 28 August 1998) is a Pakistani actor and model who works in Urdu television. Raza is known for portraying Daniyal in Muhabbat Gumshuda Meri (2023) and Shahnawaz Shah in Iqtidar (2024-2025).

In January 2025, Dawn included him in the list of the 7 "Pakistani actors who stood out in 2024.

Early life and education
Ali Raza was born and brought up in Lahore, Pakistan.[6]

After doing a one-year diploma in graphic design, he studied at the Forman Christian College before joining the University of the Punjab, earning his degree in arts and design.

Career Model
Ali Raza started his career as a model in 2018.[6][7] As a model, he worked with some of the country's top fashion designers and commercial brands.

Actor
He made his acting debut in 2020 with Hum TV's drama Bhool Jaa Ay Dil. In 2023, he appeared in the Pakistani dramas Gunah, Meesni and Mohabbat Kay Baad. In 2024, he played Daniyal in Muhabbat Gumshuda Meri, Murad Shah in Noor Jahan, Nayab Adam in Duniyapur and Shahnawaz Shah in Iqtidar.

ali raza,ali raza actor, ali raza new drama, ali raza interview, ali raza dramas, ali raza biography,ali raza drama, ali raza actor drama, ali raza actor age, ali raza wife, khushal khan and ali raza drama, ali raza family, ali raza father, ali raza mother, pakistani actor ali raza, ali raza actor brother, ali raza actor interview, ali raza all drama, ali raza drama name, ali raza drama 2025, ali raza dastak drama, ali raza age,ali raza bio, top 7 ali raza dramas

Vasay Chaudhry (born on 12 November 1981) is a Pakistani screenwriter, actor, director, producer, host, and comedian. He is best known for writing sitcoms and comedy-dramas for Pakistani televisions. He is also known for writing films. He wrote Main Hoon Shahid Afridi and Jawani Phir Nahi Ani. While Mai Hoon Shahid Afridi was an average success, Jawani phir Nahe Ani went on to become the highest grossing film of Pakistan cinema and broke all the previous box office records while earning more than 490 million at the box office. He also wrote Jawani Phir Nahi Ani 2, which was released on 2018 Eid al-Adha and broke the all time biggest box office grosses record. It also went on to become the first Pakistani film to make 700 Million rupees worldwide.

videos_data.title: Gup Shab With Vasay Chaudhry | Saba Hameed | Ali Raza | Iftikhar Thakur | Qaiser Piya | Full Program
videos_data.description:
#gupshabwithvasaych #iftikharthakur #qaiserpiya #vasaychaudhry #gupshabwithvasaych #sabahameed #aliraza #actresssabahameed #actoraliraza #alirazaactor 

Gup Shab With Vasay Chaudhry | Saba Hameed | Ali Raza | Iftikhar Thakur | Qaiser Piya | Full Program

Who is Saba Hameed? 

Saba Hameed  is a Pakistani actress and director.

She is one of the most popular actresses of Pakistan. She was one of the most successful actress of 1980s and 1990s. She got early recognition with her role of Sumbul in sitcom Family Front which broadcast for five years. Her recent recent roles are in the TV drama series Kahin Deep Jaley, Mere Humsafar and Fitoor.

Early life
Saba was born in Lahore, Pakistan, to writer and columnist Hameed Akhtar and Saadia, a film producer. She studied at the Lahore College for Women University. Her siblings include three sisters, with Huma and Lalarukh having also been actresses, and one brother.

Career
Saba Hameed started her four-decade-long career as an actress in 1978 on television and also worked in theatre from the mid-1980s to the mid-1990s. Saba has portrayed mother's role in many dramas & telefilms.

Personal life
Saba Hameed was previously married to Syed Pervaiz Shafi, with whom she had two children: a daughter, actress and singer Meesha Shafi, and a son, Faris Shafi.She is currently married to actor Waseem Abbas. Actor Ali Abbas is Waseem Abbas's son from his first marriage. Saba's two younger sisters, Huma Hameed and Lalarukh Hameed are both actresses. Lalarukh worked in dramas Mata-e-Gharoor, Andhera Ujala, Wafa, Dasht-E-Tanhai and Hazaron Raaste.

Whos is Ali Raza?

Muhammad Ali Raza (born 28 August 1998) is a Pakistani actor and model who works in Urdu television. Raza is known for portraying Daniyal in Muhabbat Gumshuda Meri (2023) and Shahnawaz Shah in Iqtidar (2024-2025).

In January 2025, Dawn included him in the list of the 7 "Pakistani actors who stood out in 2024.

Early life and education
Ali Raza was born and brought up in Lahore, Pakistan.[6]

After doing a one-year diploma in graphic design, he studied at the Forman Christian College before joining the University of the Punjab, earning his degree in arts and design.

Career Model
Ali Raza started his career as a model in 2018.[6][7] As a model, he worked with some of the country's top fashion designers and commercial brands.

Actor
He made his acting debut in 2020 with Hum TV's drama Bhool Jaa Ay Dil. In 2023, he appeared in the Pakistani dramas Gunah, Meesni and Mohabbat Kay Baad. In 2024, he played Daniyal in Muhabbat Gumshuda Meri, Murad Shah in Noor Jahan, Nayab Adam in Duniyapur and Shahnawaz Shah in Iqtidar.

ali raza,ali raza actor, ali raza new drama, ali raza interview, ali raza dramas, ali raza biography,ali raza drama, ali raza actor drama, ali raza actor age, ali raza wife, khushal khan and ali raza drama, ali raza family, ali raza father, ali raza mother, pakistani actor ali raza, ali raza actor brother, ali raza actor interview, ali raza all drama, ali raza drama name, ali raza drama 2025, ali raza dastak drama, ali raza age,ali raza bio, top 7 ali raza dramas

Vasay Chaudhry (born on 12 November 1981) is a Pakistani screenwriter, actor, director, producer, host, and comedian. He is best known for writing sitcoms and comedy-dramas for Pakistani televisions. He is also known for writing films. He wrote Main Hoon Shahid Afridi and Jawani Phir Nahi Ani. While Mai Hoon Shahid Afridi was an average success, Jawani phir Nahe Ani went on to become the highest grossing film of Pakistan cinema and broke all the previous box office records while earning more than 490 million at the box office. He also wrote Jawani Phir Nahi Ani 2, which was released on 2018 Eid al-Adha and broke the all time biggest box office grosses record. It also went on to become the first Pakistani film to make 700 Million rupees worldwide.

videos_data.title: Samaa TV Becomes Multan Sultans' Media Partner for PSL 10 | Ali Tareen Video Message | SAMAA TV
videos_data.description:
#SAMAALIVE #multansultan #mediapartner #psl10 #samaatv #nadeemmalik 

Samaa TV Becomes Multan Sultans' Media Partner for PSL 10 | Ali Tareen Video Message | SAMAA TV

On this occasion, the Sultans' owner, Ali Tareen expressed optimism about the partnership with Samaa TV again. “We are delighted to welcome Samaa TV as our official media partner for the Pakistan Super League and beyond," he said.

"Samaa TV’s through on-screen and digital media reach and credibility align perfectly with our vision of growing our fan base and keeping our supporters engaged throughout the year," Tareen said.

He said, "Their commitment to cricket coverage will ensure that Multan Sultans’ journey, both on and off the field, is brought to the fans in an exciting and engaging manner."

“Multan Sultans are built on the values of professionalism and performance, and we are confident that this partnership will be mutually beneficial," he said.

Tareen maintained, "Through Samaa TV, we will not only connect with our fans during HBL PSL but also promote our grassroots initiatives, which are instrumental in identifying and nurturing emerging men’s and women’s cricketers for future success.”

videos_data.title: Ali Tareen's special message after Samaa TV becomes Multan Sultans' partner | SAMAA TV
videos_data.description:
#SAMAALIVE #multansultan #mediapartner #psl10 #samaatv #nadeemmalik 

Ali Tareen's special message after Samaa TV becomes Multan Sultans' partner | SAMAA TV

Samaa TV becomes Multan Sultans' media partner for PSL 10

On this occasion, the Sultans' owner, Ali Tareen expressed optimism about the partnership with Samaa TV again. “We are delighted to welcome Samaa TV as our official media partner for the Pakistan Super League and beyond," he said.

"Samaa TV’s through on-screen and digital media reach and credibility align perfectly with our vision of growing our fan base and keeping our supporters engaged throughout the year," Tareen said.

He said, "Their commitment to cricket coverage will ensure that Multan Sultans’ journey, both on and off the field, is brought to the fans in an exciting and engaging manner."

“Multan Sultans are built on the values of professionalism and performance, and we are confident that this partnership will be mutually beneficial," he said.

Tareen maintained, "Through Samaa TV, we will not only connect with our fans during HBL PSL but also promote our grassroots initiatives, which are instrumental in identifying and nurturing emerging men’s and women’s cricketers for future success.”

videos_data.title: Samaa TV becomes Multan Sultans' media partner for PSL 10 | Watch Ali Tareen Video message
videos_data.description:
#SAMAALIVE #multansultan #mediapartner #psl10 #samaatv #nadeemmalik 

Samaa TV becomes Multan Sultans' media partner for PSL 10

On this occasion, the Sultans' owner, Ali Tareen expressed optimism about the partnership with Samaa TV again. “We are delighted to welcome Samaa TV as our official media partner for the Pakistan Super League and beyond," he said.

"Samaa TV’s through on-screen and digital media reach and credibility align perfectly with our vision of growing our fan base and keeping our supporters engaged throughout the year," Tareen said.

He said, "Their commitment to cricket coverage will ensure that Multan Sultans’ journey, both on and off the field, is brought to the fans in an exciting and engaging manner."

“Multan Sultans are built on the values of professionalism and performance, and we are confident that this partnership will be mutually beneficial," he said.

Tareen maintained, "Through Samaa TV, we will not only connect with our fans during HBL PSL but also promote our grassroots initiatives, which are instrumental in identifying and nurturing emerging men’s and women’s cricketers for future success.”

videos_data.title: Eid ul Fitr 2025 | Day 3 Special Transmission | Arshad Nadeem | Sawera Pasha | Zor Ka Jor
videos_data.description:
#samaatv #sawerapasha #cricket #zorkajor #sawerapasha #Nadeemarshad  #mnadeem #arshadnadeem #arshadnadeemgoldmedal #arshadnadeemwins #arshadnadeemolympics 

Eid ul Fitr 2025 | Day 3 Special Transmission | Arshad Nadeem | Sawera Pasha | Zor Ka Jor 

Who is Arshad Nadeem? 

Arshad Nadeem PP HI is a Pakistani javelin thrower. He is the reigning Olympic and Commonwealth Games champion and the current silver medalist in the World Athletics Championship. His 92.97 metres (305.0 ft) throw at the 2024 Summer Olympics is an Olympic and Asian record and also the sixth longest throw in the history of javelin throw, when considering only the best throw from each athlete.

He is a two-time Olympian, and the first Pakistani to qualify for the final of any track and field event at the Olympic Games[8] and the World Athletics Championships.

At the 2022 Commonwealth Games, he set a new national and Commonwealth Games record with a throw of 90.18 m (295.9 ft) and became the first athlete from South Asia to breach the 90 m mark.[10] In the 2023 World Athletics Championships, he became the first Pakistani athlete to win a medal at the World Athletics Championships, a silver. He represents the Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA) in the National Games of Pakistan.

Early life

Arshad Nadeem was born into a Punjabi Muslim family in Mian Channu, in the Punjab province of Pakistan. The family belongs to the Jat community. He is the third-oldest among eight siblings. Nadeem was an exceptionally versatile athlete from his early school years. Though he dabbled in all the sports on offer in his school — cricket, badminton, football and athletics — his passion was cricket, and he soon found himself playing it at district-level tape-ball tournaments.Upon entering grade seven in school, Nadeem caught the eye of Rasheed Ahmad Saqi during an athletics competition. Saqi had a history of developing sportspeople in the division, and began training Nadeem soon afterwards.

Before settling on javelin throw, Nadeem also pursued shot put and discus throw. Gold medals in the javelin throw in successive Punjab Youth Festivals and an inter-board meet propelled him on to the national stage, bringing offers from all the leading domestic departmental teams, including the athletics sections of the Pakistan Army, Air Force and Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA).[18] It was his father, Muhammad Ashraf, who persuaded him to take up the sport of javelin throwing.[20] Nadeem actually aspired to become a full-time cricketer, but he changed his mind and shifted his focus to athletics as he first picked up the javelin in 2015; Nadeem himself acknowledged that it was "the best thing that happened" to him.

2022 Islamic Games: Gold medal
Five days later, on 12 August 2022, Nadeem won another gold medal for Pakistan at the 2021 Islamic Solidarity Games. He broke the games record with his throw of 88.55 m.

In November 2022, Nadeem won the gold medal in the javelin throw, with a toss of 81.21 m, at the 50th National Athletics Championship in Lahore.[48]

Elbow and knee injury (Late 2022)
Nadeem left for the UK on 1 December 2022 to get treatment on his injured elbow and knee joint. The AFP arranged for him to be treated at Spire Cambridge Lea Hospital. After a ten-day rehabilitation and physiotherapy period, full recovery took a further four to six weeks.

2023 Pakistan National Games and knee injury
In May 2023, Nadeem participated in the 34th National Games of Pakistan and won a gold medal with the longest throw of 78.02 m during his third attempt, while representing WAPDA. However, he suffered a knee injury, which ruled him out of the Asian Athletics Championships. 

2023 World Athletics Championships: Silver medal
Nadeem won a silver medal at the 2023 World Athletics Championships in Budapest with a throw of 87.82 m. He also secured qualification for the 2024 Summer Olympics during the event.

2024 Paris Diamond League
In July 2024, Nadeem finished in fourth place in the Paris Diamond League with a 84.21m throw on his fifth attempt.

2024 Paris Olympics: Gold medal and Olympic record
At the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, Nadeem became the first Pakistani to win an Olympic medal in Athletics, by winning an Olympic gold medal. He is also the first Pakistani athlete to win an Olympic gold medal for an individual sport. He not only claimed the men's javelin throw title but set a new Olympic record of 92.97 m in the final.[58] The previous Olympic record holder was Norwegian Andreas Thorkildsen, who achieved 90.57 m at the 2008 Beijing Olympics.

Personal life
Arshad Nadeem is married and has a daughter and a son. He is a devout Muslim. Nadeem describes himself as an introvert. His coach, Salman Iqbal Butt, a former national-level discus thrower, remembered him as a very respectful and obedient athlete who bowed his head as he listened to his coach's words.

localized.title: Eid ul Fitr 2025 | Day 3 Special Transmission | Arshad Nadeem | Sawera Pasha | Zor Ka Jor
localized.description:
#samaatv #sawerapasha #cricket #zorkajor #sawerapasha #Nadeemarshad  #mnadeem #arshadnadeem #arshadnadeemgoldmedal #arshadnadeemwins #arshadnadeemolympics 

Eid ul Fitr 2025 | Day 3 Special Transmission | Arshad Nadeem | Sawera Pasha | Zor Ka Jor 

Who is Arshad Nadeem? 

Arshad Nadeem PP HI is a Pakistani javelin thrower. He is the reigning Olympic and Commonwealth Games champion and the current silver medalist in the World Athletics Championship. His 92.97 metres (305.0 ft) throw at the 2024 Summer Olympics is an Olympic and Asian record and also the sixth longest throw in the history of javelin throw, when considering only the best throw from each athlete.

He is a two-time Olympian, and the first Pakistani to qualify for the final of any track and field event at the Olympic Games[8] and the World Athletics Championships.

At the 2022 Commonwealth Games, he set a new national and Commonwealth Games record with a throw of 90.18 m (295.9 ft) and became the first athlete from South Asia to breach the 90 m mark.[10] In the 2023 World Athletics Championships, he became the first Pakistani athlete to win a medal at the World Athletics Championships, a silver. He represents the Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA) in the National Games of Pakistan.

Early life

Arshad Nadeem was born into a Punjabi Muslim family in Mian Channu, in the Punjab province of Pakistan. The family belongs to the Jat community. He is the third-oldest among eight siblings. Nadeem was an exceptionally versatile athlete from his early school years. Though he dabbled in all the sports on offer in his school — cricket, badminton, football and athletics — his passion was cricket, and he soon found himself playing it at district-level tape-ball tournaments.Upon entering grade seven in school, Nadeem caught the eye of Rasheed Ahmad Saqi during an athletics competition. Saqi had a history of developing sportspeople in the division, and began training Nadeem soon afterwards.

Before settling on javelin throw, Nadeem also pursued shot put and discus throw. Gold medals in the javelin throw in successive Punjab Youth Festivals and an inter-board meet propelled him on to the national stage, bringing offers from all the leading domestic departmental teams, including the athletics sections of the Pakistan Army, Air Force and Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA).[18] It was his father, Muhammad Ashraf, who persuaded him to take up the sport of javelin throwing.[20] Nadeem actually aspired to become a full-time cricketer, but he changed his mind and shifted his focus to athletics as he first picked up the javelin in 2015; Nadeem himself acknowledged that it was "the best thing that happened" to him.

2022 Islamic Games: Gold medal
Five days later, on 12 August 2022, Nadeem won another gold medal for Pakistan at the 2021 Islamic Solidarity Games. He broke the games record with his throw of 88.55 m.

In November 2022, Nadeem won the gold medal in the javelin throw, with a toss of 81.21 m, at the 50th National Athletics Championship in Lahore.[48]

Elbow and knee injury (Late 2022)
Nadeem left for the UK on 1 December 2022 to get treatment on his injured elbow and knee joint. The AFP arranged for him to be treated at Spire Cambridge Lea Hospital. After a ten-day rehabilitation and physiotherapy period, full recovery took a further four to six weeks.

2023 Pakistan National Games and knee injury
In May 2023, Nadeem participated in the 34th National Games of Pakistan and won a gold medal with the longest throw of 78.02 m during his third attempt, while representing WAPDA. However, he suffered a knee injury, which ruled him out of the Asian Athletics Championships. 

2023 World Athletics Championships: Silver medal
Nadeem won a silver medal at the 2023 World Athletics Championships in Budapest with a throw of 87.82 m. He also secured qualification for the 2024 Summer Olympics during the event.

2024 Paris Diamond League
In July 2024, Nadeem finished in fourth place in the Paris Diamond League with a 84.21m throw on his fifth attempt.

2024 Paris Olympics: Gold medal and Olympic record
At the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, Nadeem became the first Pakistani to win an Olympic medal in Athletics, by winning an Olympic gold medal. He is also the first Pakistani athlete to win an Olympic gold medal for an individual sport. He not only claimed the men's javelin throw title but set a new Olympic record of 92.97 m in the final.[58] The previous Olympic record holder was Norwegian Andreas Thorkildsen, who achieved 90.57 m at the 2008 Beijing Olympics.

Personal life
Arshad Nadeem is married and has a daughter and a son. He is a devout Muslim. Nadeem describes himself as an introvert. His coach, Salman Iqbal Butt, a former national-level discus thrower, remembered him as a very respectful and obedient athlete who bowed his head as he listened to his coach's words.

Bold and charismatic actress, Veena Malik, sets the set of Samaa Digital show, 'Punjabi Kuriyan', on fire! From singing and dancing to sharing hilarious anecdotes, Veena spills the tea on her 'Bigg Boss' journey, her rumored affair with Ashmit Patel, and the real reason behind her elimination. Don’t miss this fun-filled, candid episode packed with laughter, entertainment, and untold secrets!


veena malik, veena malik interview, veena malik husband, veena malik bigg boss, veena malik movies, veena malik show, veena malik song, veena malik naat, veena malik khan, veena malik video, veena malik in india, veena malik podcast, veena malik earning, veena malik divorce, veena malik pr ilzamat, veena malik photoshoot, veena malik salman khan, veena malik second marriage, veena malik and ashmit patel, veena malik interview in pakistan

Who is Veena Malik? 

Zahida Malik (born 26 February, 1976), better known as Veena Malik, is a Pakistani actress, TV host, reality television personality who has appeared in Pakistani and Bollywood films.[3][4] Veena made her film debut in 2000 with Sajjad Gul's Tere Pyar Mein. In 2002, she starred in Akbar Khan's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa and Sassi Punno and later played roles in female-centric films such as Koi Tujh Sa Kahan (2005) and Mohabbatan Sachiyan (2007). She was a contestant on Bigg Boss in 2010.

Early life
Veena was born as Zahida Malik[5] on 26 February, 1976[6][7] in Rawalpindi, Punjab, Pakistan,[8] to Malik Mohammad Aslam and his wife, Zeenat Malik.

Career  Television. 
In 2002, Veena hosted the Prime TV series, Prime Gupshup for them ushering a new direction for her comic skills and she improvised on the hour-long show occasionally mimicking actors.

Veena hosted the Geo TV show Hum Sub Umeed Se Hain, in which she was hailed for her comedic parodies. In 2007, she appeared at the Lux Style Awards and was awarded as being the Most stylish celebrity on the carpet.

In October 2010, Veena appeared in the Indian television reality show Bigg Boss Season 4. She was evicted two weeks before the finals, and was one of the final six contestants out of the original fourteen who had participated. Veena was also part of the finale of the show. After her Bigg Boss stay, she was mentioned in the media as the voice of liberal Muslims, including leading dailies, Daily Times, Express Tribune, and The Australian.[ Sabbah Haji, from the Haji Amina Charity Trust in Jammu and Kashmir, writing in the magazine Tehelka, when comparing her with liberal rector of Darul Uloom Deoband said, "these two newly public figures might teach Muslims to stop feeling eternally outraged."

In February 2011, Veena became part of the Cricket World Cup reality show in Delhi, India, called "Big Toss." Big Toss was a reality game show with contestants and Veena as the captain of one team, against Rakhi Sawant and her team.

In March 2011, Veena engaged in a passionate debate with a mufti, who claimed she had engaged in immoral behaviour as a contestant on Bigg Boss, even though he admitted to not having watched the show. Veena countered pointing out the double standards of Pakistani media against women among other rebuttals.

Another show Veena Malik – Veena Ka Vivah was planned where Veena would search for her soul-mate, but the show was cancelled when Imagine TV, the channel on which the show was being shown, announced that it was shutting down. Veena collected almost 71,000 entries from all over the world for the show.

Films
Veena made her acting debut alongside Shaan and Zara Sheikh in Askari's Tere Pyar Mein (2000). She played a supporting role in the film and was barely acknowledged. Later on, she appeared in a supporting role in Javed Sheikh's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa (2002).

FHM images

Controversy resulted in Pakistan over a Viral image of Veena on the cover of FHM magazine India edition

Guest:
* Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed 

Hiba Bukhari and Arez Ahmed, one of Pakistan's beloved celebrity couples, continue to win hearts with their chemistry on and off-screen. Fans can’t get enough of this power couple, from their stunning appearances to adorable moments. Stay tuned for the latest updates on their projects, interviews, and personal life!

who is hiba bukhari?

Hiba Bukhari is a Pakistani actress known for her work in Urdu television dramas. She gained popularity for her roles in hit dramas like "Bholi Bano," "Deewangi," "Fitoor," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
She is admired for her natural acting, graceful personality, and on-screen chemistry with various co-stars. Hiba won the Best Soap Actress award at the Hum Awards for her role in Thori Si Wafa.
In 2021, she married fellow actor Arez Ahmed, and their real-life love story has made them a beloved celebrity couple in Pakistan.

who is arez ahmed?

Arez Ahmed is a Pakistani actor known for his roles in Urdu television dramas. He started his career with supporting roles and gradually gained recognition for his performances in dramas like "Mehar Posh," "Wafa Be Mol," "Inteha-e-Ishq," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
He is appreciated for his versatility and on-screen presence. In 2021, Arez Ahmed married Hiba Bukhari, and together, they are one of Pakistan's most loved celebrity couples

Would you like to know about his latest projects?

Arez Ahmed has been actively involved in several recent projects:​
"Bajjo" (2024–2025): A family drama where Arez portrays the character Sohail. The series blends light-hearted moments with emotional narratives. ​
YouTube
"Chaal" (2024): In this series, Arez plays Rahil, showcasing his versatility as an actor. ​
IMDb
Additionally, Arez and his wife, Hiba Bukhari, celebrated Eid ul Fitr 2025 together, sharing festive moments with their fans. ​
Instagram

videos_data.title: Medical college fees Rs. 1.8 million? | Senior Journalist Tikka Khan Sani Breaks Big News
videos_data.description:
#samaatv  #medicalcollege #islamabad #medical #medicalstudent #medicalcollegestudents #fee

Medical college fees Rs. 1.8 million? | Senior Journalist Tikka Khan Sani Breaks Big News

The Committee on Medical Education Reforms on Thursday determined that the annual tuition fee for private medical and dental colleges should be capped at Rs 1.8 million. The committee which was constituted by the Prime Minister of Pakistan and chaired by the Deputy Prime Minister, has successfully reached a consensus decision. After careful evaluation of the financial data and justifications provided by the institutions and based on the  recommendations of the sub-committee, the Committee on Medical Education Reforms made this decision, setting a cap on the tuition fee for private MBBS and BDS programs.

Hiba Ka Nick Name Sun Kar Arez Aur Madiha Hans Hans Kar Behaal | Samaa TV

Host: Madeha Naqvi
Guest:
* Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed 

Hiba Bukhari and Arez Ahmed, one of Pakistan's beloved celebrity couples, continue to win hearts with their chemistry on and off-screen. Fans can’t get enough of this power couple, from their stunning appearances to adorable moments. Stay tuned for the latest updates on their projects, interviews, and personal life!

who is hiba bukhari?

Hiba Bukhari is a Pakistani actress known for her work in Urdu television dramas. She gained popularity for her roles in hit dramas like "Bholi Bano," "Deewangi," "Fitoor," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
She is admired for her natural acting, graceful personality, and on-screen chemistry with various co-stars. Hiba won the Best Soap Actress award at the Hum Awards for her role in Thori Si Wafa.
In 2021, she married fellow actor Arez Ahmed, and their real-life love story has made them a beloved celebrity couple in Pakistan.

who is arez ahmed?

Arez Ahmed is a Pakistani actor known for his roles in Urdu television dramas. He started his career with supporting roles and gradually gained recognition for his performances in dramas like "Mehar Posh," "Wafa Be Mol," "Inteha-e-Ishq," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
He is appreciated for his versatility and on-screen presence. In 2021, Arez Ahmed married Hiba Bukhari, and together, they are one of Pakistan's most loved celebrity couples

Would you like to know about his latest projects?

Arez Ahmed has been actively involved in several recent projects:​
"Bajjo" (2024–2025): A family drama where Arez portrays the character Sohail. The series blends light-hearted moments with emotional narratives. ​
YouTube
"Chaal" (2024): In this series, Arez plays Rahil, showcasing his versatility as an actor. ​
IMDb
Additionally, Arez and his wife, Hiba Bukhari, celebrated Eid ul Fitr 2025 together, sharing festive moments with their fans. ​
Instagram

videos_data.title: Haris Rauf injured by bouncer in second ODI against New Zealand | Breaking News
videos_data.description:
#samaatv #harisrauf #pakista #newzealand 

Pakistan cricket team's fast bowler Haris Rauf has suffered an injury while batting in the second ODI against New Zealand on Wednesday.

The second ODI between Pakistan and New Zealand was played at Seddon Park in Hamilton. During the match, fast bowler Haris Rauf suffered an injury while batting.

A dangerous bouncer from New Zealand fast bowler Will O'Rourke hit Haris Rauf's helmet, after which he was declared retired hurt and left the field.

videos_data.title: Dil E Umeed Tora Hai Kisi Ne Live Qawwali By Asif Ali Santoo | Eid Da Samaa | SAMAA TV
videos_data.description:
#samaatv #santooqawwali #eiddasamaa #sohailwarraich #eid #eidspecial #toufeeqbutt #faizaimdad 

Dil E Umeed Tora Hai Kisi Ne Live Qawwali By Asif Ali Santoo | Eid Da Samaa | Special Program | SAMAA TV

Santoo Khan Qawwal, a renowned name in the world of Qawwali, mesmerizes audiences with his soulful voice and traditional Sufi renditions. Carrying forward the rich legacy of Qawwali, his performances captivate music lovers worldwide. Experience the magic of his powerful vocals and spiritual melodies that touch the heart and soul. Stay tuned for his latest performances, interviews, and timeless classics!

Who is Santoo Khan?

Asif Ali Santoo Khan, born on February 8, 1973, in Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan, is a distinguished Qawwali singer renowned for his soulful performances and dedication to Sufi devotional music. His musical heritage spans over 350 years, tracing back to his great-grandfather, Mian Maula Baksh, a celebrated classical singer of the Indian subcontinent. His grandfather, Ustad Manzoor Hussain Santoo Khan, further enriched this legacy by settling in Lahore after the 1947 partition and becoming a prominent figure in Pakistan's music scene. ​

Asif Ali Santoo Khan began his musical training under the guidance of his father and grandfather, immersing himself in the rich traditions of Qawwali. His passion and talent led him to become a disciple of the legendary Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, who regarded Asif as one of his finest students. This mentorship significantly influenced Asif's style, blending classical elements with his unique interpretations. ​
For those interested in experiencing his music, Asif Ali Santoo Khan maintains an active presence on social media platforms, including Instagram and YouTube, where he shares his latest performances and updates. ​
To get a glimpse of his captivating performances, you might enjoy this rendition of "Dil E Umeed Tora Hai Kisi Ne":

Sohail Khan Warraich 

Sohail Warraich is a renowned Pakistani journalist, analyst, and television host known for his in-depth political insights and distinctive interviewing style. With years of experience in investigative journalism, he has interviewed some of the most influential political figures in Pakistan. His famous show ‘Aik Din Geo Ke Saath’ has been widely praised for its candid and engaging format. Stay updated with his latest analyses, interviews, and expert opinions on current affairs

Host: Madeha Naqvi
Guest:
* Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed 

Hiba Bukhari and Arez Ahmed, one of Pakistan's beloved celebrity couples, continue to win hearts with their chemistry on and off-screen. Fans can’t get enough of this power couple, from their stunning appearances to adorable moments. Stay tuned for the latest updates on their projects, interviews, and personal life!

who is hiba bukhari?

Hiba Bukhari is a Pakistani actress known for her work in Urdu television dramas. She gained popularity for her roles in hit dramas like "Bholi Bano," "Deewangi," "Fitoor," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
She is admired for her natural acting, graceful personality, and on-screen chemistry with various co-stars. Hiba won the Best Soap Actress award at the Hum Awards for her role in Thori Si Wafa.
In 2021, she married fellow actor Arez Ahmed, and their real-life love story has made them a beloved celebrity couple in Pakistan.

who is arez ahmed?

Arez Ahmed is a Pakistani actor known for his roles in Urdu television dramas. He started his career with supporting roles and gradually gained recognition for his performances in dramas like "Mehar Posh," "Wafa Be Mol," "Inteha-e-Ishq," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
He is appreciated for his versatility and on-screen presence. In 2021, Arez Ahmed married Hiba Bukhari, and together, they are one of Pakistan's most loved celebrity couples

Would you like to know about his latest projects?

Arez Ahmed has been actively involved in several recent projects:​
"Bajjo" (2024–2025): A family drama where Arez portrays the character Sohail. The series blends light-hearted moments with emotional narratives. ​
YouTube
"Chaal" (2024): In this series, Arez plays Rahil, showcasing his versatility as an actor. ​
IMDb
Additionally, Arez and his wife, Hiba Bukhari, celebrated Eid ul Fitr 2025 together, sharing festive moments with their fans. ​
Instagram

Host: Madeha Naqvi
Guest:
* Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed 

Hiba Bukhari and Arez Ahmed, one of Pakistan's beloved celebrity couples, continue to win hearts with their chemistry on and off-screen. Fans can’t get enough of this power couple, from their stunning appearances to adorable moments. Stay tuned for the latest updates on their projects, interviews, and personal life!

who is hiba bukhari?

Hiba Bukhari is a Pakistani actress known for her work in Urdu television dramas. She gained popularity for her roles in hit dramas like "Bholi Bano," "Deewangi," "Fitoor," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
She is admired for her natural acting, graceful personality, and on-screen chemistry with various co-stars. Hiba won the Best Soap Actress award at the Hum Awards for her role in Thori Si Wafa.
In 2021, she married fellow actor Arez Ahmed, and their real-life love story has made them a beloved celebrity couple in Pakistan.

who is arez ahmed?

Arez Ahmed is a Pakistani actor known for his roles in Urdu television dramas. He started his career with supporting roles and gradually gained recognition for his performances in dramas like "Mehar Posh," "Wafa Be Mol," "Inteha-e-Ishq," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
He is appreciated for his versatility and on-screen presence. In 2021, Arez Ahmed married Hiba Bukhari, and together, they are one of Pakistan's most loved celebrity couples

Would you like to know about his latest projects?

Arez Ahmed has been actively involved in several recent projects:​
"Bajjo" (2024–2025): A family drama where Arez portrays the character Sohail. The series blends light-hearted moments with emotional narratives. ​
YouTube
"Chaal" (2024): In this series, Arez plays Rahil, showcasing his versatility as an actor. ​
IMDb
Additionally, Arez and his wife, Hiba Bukhari, celebrated Eid ul Fitr 2025 together, sharing festive moments with their fans. ​
Instagram

who is hiba bukhari?

Hiba Bukhari is a Pakistani actress known for her work in Urdu television dramas. She gained popularity for her roles in hit dramas like "Bholi Bano," "Deewangi," "Fitoor," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
She is admired for her natural acting, graceful personality, and on-screen chemistry with various co-stars. Hiba won the Best Soap Actress award at the Hum Awards for her role in Thori Si Wafa.
In 2021, she married fellow actor Arez Ahmed, and their real-life love story has made them a beloved celebrity couple in Pakistan.

who is arez ahmed?

Arez Ahmed is a Pakistani actor known for his roles in Urdu television dramas. He started his career with supporting roles and gradually gained recognition for his performances in dramas like "Mehar Posh," "Wafa Be Mol," "Inteha-e-Ishq," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
He is appreciated for his versatility and on-screen presence. In 2021, Arez Ahmed married Hiba Bukhari, and together, they are one of Pakistan's most loved celebrity couples

videos_data.title: Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed | Eid Ka Samaa With Madeha Naqvi | Day 3 | 2nd April 2025 | Samaa TV
videos_data.description:
#SamaaTV #madehanaqvi #Eid #SpecialTransmission #subhkasamaa #eidkasamaa #eidulfitr #song 

Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed | Eid Ka Samaa With Madeha Naqvi | Day 3 | Eid Special Program | 2nd April 2025 | Samaa TV

Host: Madeha Naqvi
Guest:
* Hiba Bukhari & Arez Ahmed 

Hiba Bukhari and Arez Ahmed, one of Pakistan's beloved celebrity couples, continue to win hearts with their chemistry on and off-screen. Fans can’t get enough of this power couple, from their stunning appearances to adorable moments. Stay tuned for the latest updates on their projects, interviews, and personal life!

who is hiba bukhari?

Hiba Bukhari is a Pakistani actress known for her work in Urdu television dramas. She gained popularity for her roles in hit dramas like "Bholi Bano," "Deewangi," "Fitoor," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
She is admired for her natural acting, graceful personality, and on-screen chemistry with various co-stars. Hiba won the Best Soap Actress award at the Hum Awards for her role in Thori Si Wafa.
In 2021, she married fellow actor Arez Ahmed, and their real-life love story has made them a beloved celebrity couple in Pakistan.

who is arez ahmed?

Arez Ahmed is a Pakistani actor known for his roles in Urdu television dramas. He started his career with supporting roles and gradually gained recognition for his performances in dramas like "Mehar Posh," "Wafa Be Mol," "Inteha-e-Ishq," and "Tere Ishq Ke Naam."
He is appreciated for his versatility and on-screen presence. In 2021, Arez Ahmed married Hiba Bukhari, and together, they are one of Pakistan's most loved celebrity couples

Would you like to know about his latest projects?

Arez Ahmed has been actively involved in several recent projects:​
"Bajjo" (2024–2025): A family drama where Arez portrays the character Sohail. The series blends light-hearted moments with emotional narratives. ​
YouTube
"Chaal" (2024): In this series, Arez plays Rahil, showcasing his versatility as an actor. ​
IMDb
Additionally, Arez and his wife, Hiba Bukhari, celebrated Eid ul Fitr 2025 together, sharing festive moments with their fans. ​
Instagram

Vaneezah Ahmad Breaks Silence on Controversy with Ayeza Khan | Gup Shup

Who is Mikaal Zulfiqar? 

Mian Mikaal Patras Zulfiqar (born 5 September 1981), commonly known as Mikaal Zulfiqar (Urdu: مکال ذوالفقار), is a British-Pakistani actor and former model. He has appeared in a number of Pakistani television series. He has also acted in a few Indian films and is currently active in Pakistani films. He is one of the highest paid Pakistani actors. In 2015, he won the Best Actor (Popular) Award at Hum TV Awards due to his performance in the television series Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.

Born in London, he moved to Pakistan and initially began his career as a model in the early 2000s and caught the attention of the team of Abrar-ul-Haq, who cast him in the singer's music video for Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya. He made his film debut in 2007 with the Bollywood crime thriller film Godfather, followed by starring roles in Shoot on Sight (2008), U R My Jaan (2011), and Baby (2015). He also began his film career in Pakistan with a supporting character in the critically acclaimed film Cake (2018). Zulfiqar has since played leading roles in Na Band Na Baraati (2018) and Sherdil (2019).

He entered the Pakistani television industry with the drama series Saiqa (2009). The hit series Pani Jaisa Piyar (2011) stabilize his position in television medium, and he went on to appear in a number of big-budget dramas, with most the notable of being include Shehr-e-Zaat (2012), Saat Pardon Mein (2012), Mirat-ul-Uroos (2012–2013), Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai (2013–2014), Diyar-e-Dil (2015), Sang-e-Mar Mar (2016–2017), and Alif Allah Aur Insaan (2017–2018).

Early life

Zulfiqar was born on 5 September 1981 in London, United Kingdom, and has six siblings. After spending his early years in London, he moved to Pakistan and attended the Lahore Lyceum School in Lahore. Additionally, he also began his career as a model and started modelling for commercials and videos that were relevant to acting.[5]

Career

After several advertising campaigns, Zulfiqar appeared in Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya, a song from the Bay Ja Cycle Tay music album by Abrar-ul-Haq.

Zulfiqar is known for his appearance in comedy commercials for Ufone. He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

After having a successful career in modelling, Zulfiqar stepped into the television industry. Some of his early screenwork includes Saiqa, Kaisay Kahoon, Pani Jaisa Piyar, and Jal Pari, among others.

He won the Best Actor title in the Hum TV Awards held in Dubai in April, 2015, for his role in the drama serial Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.He also acted in the popular show Shehr-e-Zaat opposite Mahira Khan. He has performed in many dramas opposite actress Saba Qamar as protagonist, including Pani Jaisa Piyar, Sangat, and Mein Sitara.

In 2015, he played the role of Behroz Bakhtiyar Khan in the romantic drama Diyar-e-Dil. Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. He looks amazing and reminds viewers again that he is the talented actor who could play the devil-may-care Shamraiz from Kuch Pyar ka Pagalpan or the self-absorbed, brooding Salman Ansar from Sheher-e-Zaat.'' Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics. 

Personal life
Mikaal's full birth name is Mian Muhammad Mikaal Patras Aziz Zulfiqar. His father is a retired Pakistani diplomat, and his mother is British.

videos_data.title: Teri Te Babar Azam Di Gal Nahi Banni, Tu English To Hat Ke Gal Nahi Kardi, Oo This, This Karda Ae!
videos_data.description:
#manwasisters #punjabikudiyan #asmaabbas #punjabikuriyan #punjabikudi #punjabishow #punjabisuit #punjabi #india #pakistan #indianshow #punjabiculture #punjabitransmission #veenamalik #veenamalikvideo #veenamalikpodcast #asmaabbas #asmaabbasshow #veena #babarazam 

Teri Te Babar Azam Di Gal Nahi Banni, Tu English To Hat Ke Gal Nahi Kardi, Oo This, This Karda Ae! | Veena Malik | Eid Day 2 | Punjabi Kuriyan

Bold and charismatic actress, Veena Malik, sets the set of Samaa Digital show, 'Punjabi Kuriyan', on fire! From singing and dancing to sharing hilarious anecdotes, Veena spills the tea on her 'Bigg Boss' journey, her rumored affair with Ashmit Patel, and the real reason behind her elimination. Don’t miss this fun-filled, candid episode packed with laughter, entertainment, and untold secrets!


veena malik, veena malik interview, veena malik husband, veena malik bigg boss, veena malik movies, veena malik show, veena malik song, veena malik naat, veena malik khan, veena malik video, veena malik in india, veena malik podcast, veena malik earning, veena malik divorce, veena malik pr ilzamat, veena malik photoshoot, veena malik salman khan, veena malik second marriage, veena malik and ashmit patel, veena malik interview in pakistan

Who is Veena Malik? 

Zahida Malik (born 26 February, 1976), better known as Veena Malik, is a Pakistani actress, TV host, reality television personality who has appeared in Pakistani and Bollywood films.[3][4] Veena made her film debut in 2000 with Sajjad Gul's Tere Pyar Mein. In 2002, she starred in Akbar Khan's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa and Sassi Punno and later played roles in female-centric films such as Koi Tujh Sa Kahan (2005) and Mohabbatan Sachiyan (2007). She was a contestant on Bigg Boss in 2010.

Early life
Veena was born as Zahida Malik[5] on 26 February, 1976[6][7] in Rawalpindi, Punjab, Pakistan,[8] to Malik Mohammad Aslam and his wife, Zeenat Malik.

Career  Television. 
In 2002, Veena hosted the Prime TV series, Prime Gupshup for them ushering a new direction for her comic skills and she improvised on the hour-long show occasionally mimicking actors.

Veena hosted the Geo TV show Hum Sub Umeed Se Hain, in which she was hailed for her comedic parodies. In 2007, she appeared at the Lux Style Awards and was awarded as being the Most stylish celebrity on the carpet.

In October 2010, Veena appeared in the Indian television reality show Bigg Boss Season 4. She was evicted two weeks before the finals, and was one of the final six contestants out of the original fourteen who had participated. Veena was also part of the finale of the show. After her Bigg Boss stay, she was mentioned in the media as the voice of liberal Muslims, including leading dailies, Daily Times, Express Tribune, and The Australian.[ Sabbah Haji, from the Haji Amina Charity Trust in Jammu and Kashmir, writing in the magazine Tehelka, when comparing her with liberal rector of Darul Uloom Deoband said, "these two newly public figures might teach Muslims to stop feeling eternally outraged."

In February 2011, Veena became part of the Cricket World Cup reality show in Delhi, India, called "Big Toss." Big Toss was a reality game show with contestants and Veena as the captain of one team, against Rakhi Sawant and her team.

In March 2011, Veena engaged in a passionate debate with a mufti, who claimed she had engaged in immoral behaviour as a contestant on Bigg Boss, even though he admitted to not having watched the show. Veena countered pointing out the double standards of Pakistani media against women among other rebuttals.

Another show Veena Malik – Veena Ka Vivah was planned where Veena would search for her soul-mate, but the show was cancelled when Imagine TV, the channel on which the show was being shown, announced that it was shutting down. Veena collected almost 71,000 entries from all over the world for the show.

Films
Veena made her acting debut alongside Shaan and Zara Sheikh in Askari's Tere Pyar Mein (2000). She played a supporting role in the film and was barely acknowledged. Later on, she appeared in a supporting role in Javed Sheikh's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa (2002).

FHM images

Controversy resulted in Pakistan over a Viral image of Veena on the cover of FHM magazine India edition

videos_data.title: Vaneezah Ahmad Ne Zindagi Ko Kamyab Banane Ka Tareeqa Bata Diya | Gup Shup
videos_data.description:
#gupshabwithvasaych #iftikharthakur #qaiserpiya #vasaychaudhry #gupshabwithvasaych #vanezahahmed #actorvanezahahmed #mikalzulfiqar #actormikalzulafqar 

Vaneezah Ahmad Ne Zindagi Ko Kamyab Banane Ka Tareeqa Bata Diya | Gup Shup

Who is Mikaal Zulfiqar? 

Mian Mikaal Patras Zulfiqar (born 5 September 1981), commonly known as Mikaal Zulfiqar (Urdu: مکال ذوالفقار), is a British-Pakistani actor and former model. He has appeared in a number of Pakistani television series. He has also acted in a few Indian films and is currently active in Pakistani films. He is one of the highest paid Pakistani actors. In 2015, he won the Best Actor (Popular) Award at Hum TV Awards due to his performance in the television series Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.

Born in London, he moved to Pakistan and initially began his career as a model in the early 2000s and caught the attention of the team of Abrar-ul-Haq, who cast him in the singer's music video for Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya. He made his film debut in 2007 with the Bollywood crime thriller film Godfather, followed by starring roles in Shoot on Sight (2008), U R My Jaan (2011), and Baby (2015). He also began his film career in Pakistan with a supporting character in the critically acclaimed film Cake (2018). Zulfiqar has since played leading roles in Na Band Na Baraati (2018) and Sherdil (2019).

He entered the Pakistani television industry with the drama series Saiqa (2009). The hit series Pani Jaisa Piyar (2011) stabilize his position in television medium, and he went on to appear in a number of big-budget dramas, with most the notable of being include Shehr-e-Zaat (2012), Saat Pardon Mein (2012), Mirat-ul-Uroos (2012–2013), Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai (2013–2014), Diyar-e-Dil (2015), Sang-e-Mar Mar (2016–2017), and Alif Allah Aur Insaan (2017–2018).

Early life

Zulfiqar was born on 5 September 1981 in London, United Kingdom, and has six siblings. After spending his early years in London, he moved to Pakistan and attended the Lahore Lyceum School in Lahore. Additionally, he also began his career as a model and started modelling for commercials and videos that were relevant to acting.[5]

Career

After several advertising campaigns, Zulfiqar appeared in Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya, a song from the Bay Ja Cycle Tay music album by Abrar-ul-Haq.

Zulfiqar is known for his appearance in comedy commercials for Ufone. He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

After having a successful career in modelling, Zulfiqar stepped into the television industry. Some of his early screenwork includes Saiqa, Kaisay Kahoon, Pani Jaisa Piyar, and Jal Pari, among others.

He won the Best Actor title in the Hum TV Awards held in Dubai in April, 2015, for his role in the drama serial Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.He also acted in the popular show Shehr-e-Zaat opposite Mahira Khan. He has performed in many dramas opposite actress Saba Qamar as protagonist, including Pani Jaisa Piyar, Sangat, and Mein Sitara.

In 2015, he played the role of Behroz Bakhtiyar Khan in the romantic drama Diyar-e-Dil. Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. He looks amazing and reminds viewers again that he is the talented actor who could play the devil-may-care Shamraiz from Kuch Pyar ka Pagalpan or the self-absorbed, brooding Salman Ansar from Sheher-e-Zaat.'' Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics. 

Personal life
Mikaal's full birth name is Mian Muhammad Mikaal Patras Aziz Zulfiqar. His father is a retired Pakistani diplomat, and his mother is British.

Asma Abbas Da Kide Naal Chakkar? | Veena Malik De Sawal Te Asma Abbas De Veen | Punjabi Kuriyan

Bold and charismatic actress, Veena Malik, sets the set of Samaa Digital show, 'Punjabi Kuriyan', on fire! From singing and dancing to sharing hilarious anecdotes, Veena spills the tea on her 'Bigg Boss' journey, her rumored affair with Ashmit Patel, and the real reason behind her elimination. Don’t miss this fun-filled, candid episode packed with laughter, entertainment, and untold secrets!

Who is Veena Malik? 

Zahida Malik (born 26 February, 1976), better known as Veena Malik, is a Pakistani actress, TV host, reality television personality who has appeared in Pakistani and Bollywood films.[3][4] Veena made her film debut in 2000 with Sajjad Gul's Tere Pyar Mein. In 2002, she starred in Akbar Khan's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa and Sassi Punno and later played roles in female-centric films such as Koi Tujh Sa Kahan (2005) and Mohabbatan Sachiyan (2007). She was a contestant on Bigg Boss in 2010.

Early life
Veena was born as Zahida Malik[5] on 26 February, 1976[6][7] in Rawalpindi, Punjab, Pakistan,[8] to Malik Mohammad Aslam and his wife, Zeenat Malik.

Career  Television. 
In 2002, Veena hosted the Prime TV series, Prime Gupshup for them ushering a new direction for her comic skills and she improvised on the hour-long show occasionally mimicking actors.

Veena hosted the Geo TV show Hum Sub Umeed Se Hain, in which she was hailed for her comedic parodies. In 2007, she appeared at the Lux Style Awards and was awarded as being the Most stylish celebrity on the carpet.

In October 2010, Veena appeared in the Indian television reality show Bigg Boss Season 4. She was evicted two weeks before the finals, and was one of the final six contestants out of the original fourteen who had participated. Veena was also part of the finale of the show. After her Bigg Boss stay, she was mentioned in the media as the voice of liberal Muslims, including leading dailies, Daily Times, Express Tribune, and The Australian.[ Sabbah Haji, from the Haji Amina Charity Trust in Jammu and Kashmir, writing in the magazine Tehelka, when comparing her with liberal rector of Darul Uloom Deoband said, "these two newly public figures might teach Muslims to stop feeling eternally outraged."

In February 2011, Veena became part of the Cricket World Cup reality show in Delhi, India, called "Big Toss." Big Toss was a reality game show with contestants and Veena as the captain of one team, against Rakhi Sawant and her team.

In March 2011, Veena engaged in a passionate debate with a mufti, who claimed she had engaged in immoral behaviour as a contestant on Bigg Boss, even though he admitted to not having watched the show. Veena countered pointing out the double standards of Pakistani media against women among other rebuttals.

Another show Veena Malik – Veena Ka Vivah was planned where Veena would search for her soul-mate, but the show was cancelled when Imagine TV, the channel on which the show was being shown, announced that it was shutting down. Veena collected almost 71,000 entries from all over the world for the show.

Films
Veena made her acting debut alongside Shaan and Zara Sheikh in Askari's Tere Pyar Mein (2000). She played a supporting role in the film and was barely acknowledged. Later on, she appeared in a supporting role in Javed Sheikh's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa (2002).

FHM images

Controversy resulted in Pakistan over a Viral image of Veena on the cover of FHM magazine India edition

Who is Mikaal Zulfiqar? 

Mian Mikaal Patras Zulfiqar (born 5 September 1981), commonly known as Mikaal Zulfiqar (Urdu: مکال ذوالفقار), is a British-Pakistani actor and former model. He has appeared in a number of Pakistani television series. He has also acted in a few Indian films and is currently active in Pakistani films. He is one of the highest paid Pakistani actors. In 2015, he won the Best Actor (Popular) Award at Hum TV Awards due to his performance in the television series Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.

Born in London, he moved to Pakistan and initially began his career as a model in the early 2000s and caught the attention of the team of Abrar-ul-Haq, who cast him in the singer's music video for Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya. He made his film debut in 2007 with the Bollywood crime thriller film Godfather, followed by starring roles in Shoot on Sight (2008), U R My Jaan (2011), and Baby (2015). He also began his film career in Pakistan with a supporting character in the critically acclaimed film Cake (2018). Zulfiqar has since played leading roles in Na Band Na Baraati (2018) and Sherdil (2019).

He entered the Pakistani television industry with the drama series Saiqa (2009). The hit series Pani Jaisa Piyar (2011) stabilize his position in television medium, and he went on to appear in a number of big-budget dramas, with most the notable of being include Shehr-e-Zaat (2012), Saat Pardon Mein (2012), Mirat-ul-Uroos (2012–2013), Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai (2013–2014), Diyar-e-Dil (2015), Sang-e-Mar Mar (2016–2017), and Alif Allah Aur Insaan (2017–2018).

Early life

Zulfiqar was born on 5 September 1981 in London, United Kingdom, and has six siblings. After spending his early years in London, he moved to Pakistan and attended the Lahore Lyceum School in Lahore. Additionally, he also began his career as a model and started modelling for commercials and videos that were relevant to acting.[5]

Career

After several advertising campaigns, Zulfiqar appeared in Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya, a song from the Bay Ja Cycle Tay music album by Abrar-ul-Haq.

Zulfiqar is known for his appearance in comedy commercials for Ufone. He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

After having a successful career in modelling, Zulfiqar stepped into the television industry. Some of his early screenwork includes Saiqa, Kaisay Kahoon, Pani Jaisa Piyar, and Jal Pari, among others.

He won the Best Actor title in the Hum TV Awards held in Dubai in April, 2015, for his role in the drama serial Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.He also acted in the popular show Shehr-e-Zaat opposite Mahira Khan. He has performed in many dramas opposite actress Saba Qamar as protagonist, including Pani Jaisa Piyar, Sangat, and Mein Sitara.

In 2015, he played the role of Behroz Bakhtiyar Khan in the romantic drama Diyar-e-Dil. Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. He looks amazing and reminds viewers again that he is the talented actor who could play the devil-may-care Shamraiz from Kuch Pyar ka Pagalpan or the self-absorbed, brooding Salman Ansar from Sheher-e-Zaat.'' Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics. 

Personal life
Mikaal's full birth name is Mian Muhammad Mikaal Patras Aziz Zulfiqar. His father is a retired Pakistani diplomat, and his mother is British.

Born in London, he moved to Pakistan and initially began his career as a model in the early 2000s and caught the attention of the team of Abrar-ul-Haq, who cast him in the singer's music video for Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya. He made his film debut in 2007 with the Bollywood crime thriller film Godfather, followed by starring roles in Shoot on Sight (2008), U R My Jaan (2011), and Baby (2015). He also began his film career in Pakistan with a supporting character in the critically acclaimed film Cake (2018). Zulfiqar has since played leading roles in Na Band Na Baraati (2018) and Sherdil (2019).

He entered the Pakistani television industry with the drama series Saiqa (2009). The hit series Pani Jaisa Piyar (2011) stabilize his position in television medium, and he went on to appear in a number of big-budget dramas, with most the notable of being include Shehr-e-Zaat (2012), Saat Pardon Mein (2012), Mirat-ul-Uroos (2012–2013), Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai (2013–2014), Diyar-e-Dil (2015), Sang-e-Mar Mar (2016–2017), and Alif Allah Aur Insaan (2017–2018).

Early life

Zulfiqar was born on 5 September 1981 in London, United Kingdom, and has six siblings. After spending his early years in London, he moved to Pakistan and attended the Lahore Lyceum School in Lahore. Additionally, he also began his career as a model and started modelling for commercials and videos that were relevant to acting.[5]

Career

After several advertising campaigns, Zulfiqar appeared in Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya, a song from the Bay Ja Cycle Tay music album by Abrar-ul-Haq.

Zulfiqar is known for his appearance in comedy commercials for Ufone. He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

After having a successful career in modelling, Zulfiqar stepped into the television industry. Some of his early screenwork includes Saiqa, Kaisay Kahoon, Pani Jaisa Piyar, and Jal Pari, among others.

He won the Best Actor title in the Hum TV Awards held in Dubai in April, 2015, for his role in the drama serial Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.He also acted in the popular show Shehr-e-Zaat opposite Mahira Khan. He has performed in many dramas opposite actress Saba Qamar as protagonist, including Pani Jaisa Piyar, Sangat, and Mein Sitara.

In 2015, he played the role of Behroz Bakhtiyar Khan in the romantic drama Diyar-e-Dil. Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. He looks amazing and reminds viewers again that he is the talented actor who could play the devil-may-care Shamraiz from Kuch Pyar ka Pagalpan or the self-absorbed, brooding Salman Ansar from Sheher-e-Zaat.'' Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics. 

Personal life
Mikaal's full birth name is Mian Muhammad Mikaal Patras Aziz Zulfiqar. His father is a retired Pakistani diplomat, and his mother is British.

Veena Malik Ke Punjabi Ganon Par Thumke | Asma Abbas Aur Chhanku, Manku Ka Bhi Zabardast Dance | Veena Malik | Eid Day 2 | Punjabi Kuriyan

Bold and charismatic actress, Veena Malik, sets the set of Samaa Digital show, 'Punjabi Kuriyan', on fire! From singing and dancing to sharing hilarious anecdotes, Veena spills the tea on her 'Bigg Boss' journey, her rumored affair with Ashmit Patel, and the real reason behind her elimination. Don’t miss this fun-filled, candid episode packed with laughter, entertainment, and untold secrets!


veena malik, veena malik interview, veena malik husband, veena malik bigg boss, veena malik movies, veena malik show, veena malik song, veena malik naat, veena malik khan, veena malik video, veena malik in india, veena malik podcast, veena malik earning, veena malik divorce, veena malik pr ilzamat, veena malik photoshoot, veena malik salman khan, veena malik second marriage, veena malik and ashmit patel, veena malik interview in pakistan

Who is Veena Malik? 

Zahida Malik (born 26 February, 1976), better known as Veena Malik, is a Pakistani actress, TV host, reality television personality who has appeared in Pakistani and Bollywood films.[3][4] Veena made her film debut in 2000 with Sajjad Gul's Tere Pyar Mein. In 2002, she starred in Akbar Khan's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa and Sassi Punno and later played roles in female-centric films such as Koi Tujh Sa Kahan (2005) and Mohabbatan Sachiyan (2007). She was a contestant on Bigg Boss in 2010.

Early life
Veena was born as Zahida Malik[5] on 26 February, 1976[6][7] in Rawalpindi, Punjab, Pakistan,[8] to Malik Mohammad Aslam and his wife, Zeenat Malik.

Career  Television. 
In 2002, Veena hosted the Prime TV series, Prime Gupshup for them ushering a new direction for her comic skills and she improvised on the hour-long show occasionally mimicking actors.

Veena hosted the Geo TV show Hum Sub Umeed Se Hain, in which she was hailed for her comedic parodies. In 2007, she appeared at the Lux Style Awards and was awarded as being the Most stylish celebrity on the carpet.

In October 2010, Veena appeared in the Indian television reality show Bigg Boss Season 4. She was evicted two weeks before the finals, and was one of the final six contestants out of the original fourteen who had participated. Veena was also part of the finale of the show. After her Bigg Boss stay, she was mentioned in the media as the voice of liberal Muslims, including leading dailies, Daily Times, Express Tribune, and The Australian.[ Sabbah Haji, from the Haji Amina Charity Trust in Jammu and Kashmir, writing in the magazine Tehelka, when comparing her with liberal rector of Darul Uloom Deoband said, "these two newly public figures might teach Muslims to stop feeling eternally outraged."

In February 2011, Veena became part of the Cricket World Cup reality show in Delhi, India, called "Big Toss." Big Toss was a reality game show with contestants and Veena as the captain of one team, against Rakhi Sawant and her team.

In March 2011, Veena engaged in a passionate debate with a mufti, who claimed she had engaged in immoral behaviour as a contestant on Bigg Boss, even though he admitted to not having watched the show. Veena countered pointing out the double standards of Pakistani media against women among other rebuttals.

Another show Veena Malik – Veena Ka Vivah was planned where Veena would search for her soul-mate, but the show was cancelled when Imagine TV, the channel on which the show was being shown, announced that it was shutting down. Veena collected almost 71,000 entries from all over the world for the show.

Films
Veena made her acting debut alongside Shaan and Zara Sheikh in Askari's Tere Pyar Mein (2000). She played a supporting role in the film and was barely acknowledged. Later on, she appeared in a supporting role in Javed Sheikh's Yeh Dil Aap Ka Huwa (2002).

FHM images

Controversy resulted in Pakistan over a Viral image of Veena on the cover of FHM magazine India edition

videos_data.description:
#samaatv #sawerapasha #cricket #zorkajor #sawerapasha #muhammadInam #inampehlwanbutt #inambutt #commonwealthgame #goldmedal 

Rapid Fire Round | Which Sport is Overrated and Underrated | Muhammad Inam Butt | Sawera Pasha | ZKJ

Who is Muhammad Inam? 

Muhammad Inam Butt (born 27 February 1989) is a Pakistani professional wrestler.

He won the country's second gold medal at the 2010 Commonwealth Games, bronze medal at the 2014 Asian Beach Games, gold medal at the 2016 South Asian Games, gold medal at the 2016 Asian Beach Games, silver medal at the 2016 Commonwealth Wrestling Championship, gold medal at the 2017 World Beach Wrestling Championships, silver medal at the 2017 Commonwealth Wrestling Championship. Butt won a gold medal at the 2018 Commonwealth Games, the gold medal at the 2018 World Beach Wrestling Championships, gold medal at the 2019 South Asian Games, silver medal at the 2019 World Beach Series, gold medal at the 2019 ANOC World Beach Games, bronze medal at the 2021 Asian Olympics Qualify Rounds, gold medal at the 2021 World Beach Series, gold medal at the 2021 World Beach Wrestling Series and a Silver medal at the 2022 Commonwealth Games.

Career 2010

Inam participated in the 84 kg class freestyle at the 2010 Commonwealth Games in New Delhi, India. He won the gold medal in freestyle wrestling against his Indian opponent, Anuj Kumar[1] on points (3-1)

2014

Inam was selected to participate in the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow, UK.

Inam was selected to participate in the 2014 Asian beach Games in Phuket, Thailand. Then Inam participated in the 90+ kg class Beach style. He won the bronze medal in Beach wrestling against his Serian opponent, on points (3-0)

2016

Inam participated in the 86 kg class freestyle at the 2016 12th South Asian Games in Guwahati, India. He won the gold medal in freestyle wrestling against his Indian opponent, Gopal Yaduv on points (12-4).

Inam also participated in the -90 kg class Beach wrestling|freestyle at the 2016 5th Beach Asian Games in Danang, Vietnam. He won the gold medal in freestyle wrestling against his Iranian opponent, on points (3-0).

Inam also participated in the 86 kg class freestyle at the 2016 Commonwealth Wrestling Championship in Singapore. He won the silver medal in freestyle wrestling there.

2018

Inam bagged the gold medal in the 86 kg category at the 2018 Commonwealth Games, Gold Coast by beating his opponent Nigeria's Bibo by 3:0.[5]

2021

Inam Butt missed out on the 2020 Summer Olympics due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Inam won the gold medal in the 90  kg category at the Beach wrestling world series freestyle at 2021 in Rome, Italy. Butt secured victory by beating his Ukrainian opponent by 3–0 in the final.

videos_data.title: Mikaal Zulfiqar Receives Marriage Proposal Live on TV Show | Is it Real or Planted? Watch Video
videos_data.description:
#gupshabwithvasaych #iftikharthakur #qaiserpiya #vasaychaudhry #gupshabwithvasaych #vanezahahmed #actorvanezahahmed #mikalzulfiqar #actormikalzulafqar 

Mikaal Zulfiqar Receives Marriage Proposal Live on TV Show | Is it Real or Planted? Watch Video

Who is Mikaal Zulfiqar? 

Mian Mikaal Patras Zulfiqar (born 5 September 1981), commonly known as Mikaal Zulfiqar (Urdu: مکال ذوالفقار), is a British-Pakistani actor and former model. He has appeared in a number of Pakistani television series. He has also acted in a few Indian films and is currently active in Pakistani films. He is one of the highest paid Pakistani actors. In 2015, he won the Best Actor (Popular) Award at Hum TV Awards due to his performance in the television series Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.

Born in London, he moved to Pakistan and initially began his career as a model in the early 2000s and caught the attention of the team of Abrar-ul-Haq, who cast him in the singer's music video for Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya. He made his film debut in 2007 with the Bollywood crime thriller film Godfather, followed by starring roles in Shoot on Sight (2008), U R My Jaan (2011), and Baby (2015). He also began his film career in Pakistan with a supporting character in the critically acclaimed film Cake (2018). Zulfiqar has since played leading roles in Na Band Na Baraati (2018) and Sherdil (2019).

He entered the Pakistani television industry with the drama series Saiqa (2009). The hit series Pani Jaisa Piyar (2011) stabilize his position in television medium, and he went on to appear in a number of big-budget dramas, with most the notable of being include Shehr-e-Zaat (2012), Saat Pardon Mein (2012), Mirat-ul-Uroos (2012–2013), Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai (2013–2014), Diyar-e-Dil (2015), Sang-e-Mar Mar (2016–2017), and Alif Allah Aur Insaan (2017–2018).

Early life

Zulfiqar was born on 5 September 1981 in London, United Kingdom, and has six siblings. After spending his early years in London, he moved to Pakistan and attended the Lahore Lyceum School in Lahore. Additionally, he also began his career as a model and started modelling for commercials and videos that were relevant to acting.[5]

Career

After several advertising campaigns, Zulfiqar appeared in Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya, a song from the Bay Ja Cycle Tay music album by Abrar-ul-Haq.

Zulfiqar is known for his appearance in comedy commercials for Ufone. He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

After having a successful career in modelling, Zulfiqar stepped into the television industry. Some of his early screenwork includes Saiqa, Kaisay Kahoon, Pani Jaisa Piyar, and Jal Pari, among others.

He won the Best Actor title in the Hum TV Awards held in Dubai in April, 2015, for his role in the drama serial Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.He also acted in the popular show Shehr-e-Zaat opposite Mahira Khan. He has performed in many dramas opposite actress Saba Qamar as protagonist, including Pani Jaisa Piyar, Sangat, and Mein Sitara.

In 2015, he played the role of Behroz Bakhtiyar Khan in the romantic drama Diyar-e-Dil. Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. He looks amazing and reminds viewers again that he is the talented actor who could play the devil-may-care Shamraiz from Kuch Pyar ka Pagalpan or the self-absorbed, brooding Salman Ansar from Sheher-e-Zaat.'' Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics. 

Personal life
Mikaal's full birth name is Mian Muhammad Mikaal Patras Aziz Zulfiqar. His father is a retired Pakistani diplomat, and his mother is British.

He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

After having a successful career in modelling, Zulfiqar stepped into the television industry. Some of his early screenwork includes Saiqa, Kaisay Kahoon, Pani Jaisa Piyar, and Jal Pari, among others.

Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics. 

Personal life
Mikaal's full birth name is Mian Muhammad Mikaal Patras Aziz Zulfiqar. His father is a retired Pakistani diplomat, and his mother is British.

Who is Mikaal Zulfiqar? 

Mian Mikaal Patras Zulfiqar (born 5 September 1981), commonly known as Mikaal Zulfiqar (Urdu: مکال ذوالفقار), is a British-Pakistani actor and former model. He has appeared in a number of Pakistani television series. He has also acted in a few Indian films and is currently active in Pakistani films. He is one of the highest paid Pakistani actors. In 2015, he won the Best Actor (Popular) Award at Hum TV Awards due to his performance in the television series Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai.

Born in London, he moved to Pakistan and initially began his career as a model in the early 2000s and caught the attention of the team of Abrar-ul-Haq, who cast him in the singer's music video for Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya. He made his film debut in 2007 with the Bollywood crime thriller film Godfather, followed by starring roles in Shoot on Sight (2008), U R My Jaan (2011), and Baby (2015). He also began his film career in Pakistan with a supporting character in the critically acclaimed film Cake (2018). Zulfiqar has since played leading roles in Na Band Na Baraati (2018) and Sherdil (2019).

He entered the Pakistani television industry with the drama series Saiqa (2009). The hit series Pani Jaisa Piyar (2011) stabilize his position in television medium, and he went on to appear in a number of big-budget dramas, with most the notable of being include Shehr-e-Zaat (2012), Saat Pardon Mein (2012), Mirat-ul-Uroos (2012–2013), Mohabat Subh Ka Sitara Hai (2013–2014), Diyar-e-Dil (2015), Sang-e-Mar Mar (2016–2017), and Alif Allah Aur Insaan (2017–2018).

Early life

Zulfiqar was born on 5 September 1981 in London, United Kingdom, and has six siblings. After spending his early years in London, he moved to Pakistan and attended the Lahore Lyceum School in Lahore. Additionally, he also began his career as a model and started modelling for commercials and videos that were relevant to acting.[5]

Career

After several advertising campaigns, Zulfiqar appeared in Sanu Tere Naal Pyar Ho Gya, a song from the Bay Ja Cycle Tay music album by Abrar-ul-Haq.

Zulfiqar is known for his appearance in comedy commercials for Ufone. He has also performed in Bollywood films;the crime thriller film Godfather in 2007, the drama film Shoot on Sight in 2008, the musical-romantic U R My Jaan in 2011, and the spy thriller Baby in 2015.[6] However, in an interview, he stated that he didn't dream of working in Bollywood further.

He has performed in many dramas opposite actress Saba Qamar as protagonist, including Pani Jaisa Piyar, Sangat, and Mein Sitara.

In 2015, he played the role of Behroz Bakhtiyar Khan in the romantic drama Diyar-e-Dil. Dawn praised Zulfiqar's performance and wrote, ''Meekal has finally chosen a role with depth as Behroz after a series of pot boilers. He looks amazing and reminds viewers again that he is the talented actor who could play the devil-may-care Shamraiz from Kuch Pyar ka Pagalpan or the self-absorbed, brooding Salman Ansar from Sheher-e-Zaat.'' Diyar-e-Dil was also well received by viewers.

In 2017, he was highly appreciated for his performance in the spiritual television series Alif Allah Aur Insaan. The series became one of the most-watched shows of 2017.

In March 2018, he made a special appearance in the film Cake, co-starring Aamina Sheikh, Adnan Malik, and Sanam Saeed. The film was highly praised by critics. His next film Na Band Na Baraati was released in June 2018. He said in an interview that doing that film was his way to support foreign investment in local cinema.

In 2019, he was seen in Pakistani war film Sherdil opposite Armeena Khan. The film and Zulfiqar's performance received mostly unfavourable reviews from critics.
